definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: Any of us can be attacked by the dark at anytime.
sentences.chinese: 任何我们的人都可能在任何时间被暗中进犯。

sentences.english: The toolkit also has ideas to control baboons.
sentences.chinese: 该工具包同样有制服狒狒进犯的办法。

sentences.english: We wiped out all the invading enemy.
Our soldiers repulsed the enemy forces, which invaded the front line area.
sentences.chinese: 我们的士兵击退了进犯前线地区的敌军部队。

sentences.english: It protects your system against both viruses and spyware.
sentences.chinese: 它防御你的系统免受病毒和间谍软件的进犯。

sentences.english: Our soldiers repulsed the enemy forces, which invaded the front line area.
sentences.chinese: 我们的士兵击退了进犯前线地区的敌军。

sentences.english: And how can body, laid in that white rush.
sentences.chinese: 她的肉体，在那一团雪白的进犯下。

sentences.english: the attacker cracked the racks and stacked them on the track.
sentences.chinese: 进犯者打裂搁板并把它们堆在跑道上。

sentences.english: The Kuomintang forces continued their attacks into the border areas.
sentences.chinese: 国民党军继续向边区腹地进犯。

sentences.english: We must defend our motherland from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保卫祖国防御进犯之敌。

sentences.english: If the enemy dares to invade us, we'll deal them head-on blows.
sentences.chinese: 敌人胆敢进犯，我们就给予迎头痛击。

sentences.english: In 1962 they advanced in both areas.
The soldiers held the mountain pass and beat back the intruders.
sentences.chinese: 战士们扼守住山口，打退了敌人的进犯。

definition: raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to raid/an intrusion (of the enemy, or bandit groups)
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
